headline: January jobs report, McDonald's earnings, Fed: What to Watch
summary: Market Domination Overtime Host Josh Lipton previews several of the biggest stories to come tomorrow, Wednesday, February 11, including the release of the delayed January jobs report; earnings results from companies like McDonald's (MCD), Cisco Systems (CSCO), and T-Mobile US (TMUS); and commentary from Federal Reserve Bank of Kansas City president Jeff Schmid. To watch more expert insights and analysis on the latest market action, check out more Market Domination Overtime.

headline: Retraction Shifts AppLovin Focus Back To AI Growth And Earnings
summary: Short seller CapitalWatch publicly retracted money laundering accusations against a major AppLovin shareholder, stating the claims were unsubstantiated. The retraction removed a recent reputational overhang around AppLovin, with apologies issued ahead of the company’s upcoming earnings report. Following the reversal, several analysts expressed renewed confidence in NasdaqGS:APP, citing the company’s AI focused expansion as a key driver of interest. headline: Why AppLovin (APP) Stock Is Down Today
summary: Shares of mobile app technology company AppLovin (NASDAQ:APP) fell 6.4% in the afternoon session after a UBS analyst lowered the company's price target ahead of its fourth-quarter earnings report. The analyst cut the price target on the stock to $686 from $840, while still keeping a Buy rating. This adjustment occurred just before AppLovin was set to release its financial results. The significant reduction in the price target may have signaled a more cautious outlook to investors, prompting a se

headline: AppLovin Faces Tough Questions as It Sees Rapid Growth
summary: Adtech company  AppLovin  reports its fourth-quarter earnings under a cloud of negative reports and AI disruption.  AppLovin has an ad platform that facilitates ads surrounding mobile apps, especially games, one of the last untamed wildernesses of digital advertising.  Another short-seller report from CapitalWatch in January made the more salacious claim that AppLovin had ties to international crime syndicates.

AppLovin has an ad platform that facilitates ads surrounding mobile apps, especially games, one of the last untamed wildernesses of digital advertising.  Another short-seller report from CapitalWatch in January made the more salacious claim that AppLovin had ties to international crime syndicates.

headline: AppLovin: Q4 Earnings Snapshot
summary: The average estimate of six analysts surveyed by Zacks Investment Research was for earnings of $2.89 per share. The mobile app technology company posted revenue of $1.66 billion in the period, which also topped Street forecasts. Seven analysts surveyed by Zacks expected $1.61 billion.

content.title: AppLovin: Q4 Earnings Snapshot
content.summary: The average estimate of six analysts surveyed by Zacks Investment Research was for earnings of $2.89 per share. The mobile app technology company posted revenue of $1.66 billion in the period, which also topped Street forecasts. Seven analysts surveyed by Zacks expected $1.61 billion.

headline: AppLovin Announces Fourth Quarter and Full Year 2025 Financial Results
summary: PALO ALTO, Calif., February 11, 2026--AppLovin Corporation (NASDAQ: APP) ("AppLovin"), a leading marketing platform, today announced financial results for the quarter and full year ended December 31, 2025 and posted a financial update on its Investor Relations website located at https://investors.applovin.com.

headline: AppLovin misses quarterly revenue estimates amid advertising competition
summary: Marketing platform AppLovin missed market estimates for fourth-quarter sales on Wednesday, ‌indicating tepid demand for its advertising services ‌amid increasing competition and an uncertain macroeconomic environment. Companies ranging ​from Big Tech to up-and-coming advertising platforms have been fighting each other for prized ad dollars, creating an increasingly competitive landscape, challenging providers such ‌as AppLovin. Shares of ⁠the company fell nearly 3% in extended trading, after the company reported December ⁠quarter sales of $1.66 billion, missing analysts' average estimate of $1.70 billion according to data compiled by ​LSEG.

content.title: AppLovin misses quarterly revenue estimates amid advertising competition
content.summary: Marketing platform AppLovin missed market estimates for fourth-quarter sales on Wednesday, ‌indicating tepid demand for its advertising services ‌amid increasing competition and an uncertain macroeconomic environment. Companies ranging ​from Big Tech to up-and-coming advertising platforms have been fighting each other for prized ad dollars, creating an increasingly competitive landscape, challenging providers such ‌as AppLovin. Shares of ⁠the company fell nearly 3% in extended trading, after the company reported December ⁠quarter sales of $1.66 billion, missing analysts' average estimate of $1.70 billion according to data compiled by ​LSEG.

headline: AppLovin’s (NASDAQ:APP) Q4 CY2025: Beats On Revenue
summary: Mobile app technology company AppLovin (NASDAQ:APP) beat Wall Street’s revenue expectations in Q4 CY2025, with sales up 20.8% year on year to $1.66 billion. Guidance for next quarter’s revenue was optimistic at $1.76 billion at the midpoint, 3% above analysts’ estimates. Its GAAP profit of $3.24 per share was 10.1% above analysts’ consensus estimates.

content.title: AppLovin’s (NASDAQ:APP) Q4 CY2025: Beats On Revenue
content.summary: Mobile app technology company AppLovin (NASDAQ:APP) beat Wall Street’s revenue expectations in Q4 CY2025, with sales up 20.8% year on year to $1.66 billion. Guidance for next quarter’s revenue was optimistic at $1.76 billion at the midpoint, 3% above analysts’ estimates. Its GAAP profit of $3.24 per share was 10.1% above analysts’ consensus estimates.

headline: AppLovin Reports Strong Earnings. The Stock Is Down.
summary: AppLovin  reported solid fourth-quarter earnings Wednesday afternoon.  Earnings per share were $3.24, ahead of Wall Street’s consensus estimate of $2.95.  AppLovin has an ad platform that facilitates ads surrounding mobile apps, especially games, one of the last untamed wildernesses of digital advertising.

headline: AppLovin beats quarterly revenue estimates
summary: Marketing platform AppLovin beat market estimates for fourth-quarter sales on Wednesday, boosted by strong demand for its advertising services and artificial-intelligence powered tools. However, its ‌shares fell nearly 6% ⁠in extended trading amid indications of increasing competition and an uncertain macroeconomic environment. Companies ranging from ⁠Big Tech to up-and-coming advertising platforms have been fighting each other for prized ad dollars, creating an increasingly competitive landscape, ​challenging providers ​such as AppLovin.

However, its ‌shares fell nearly 6% ⁠in extended trading amid indications of increasing competition and an uncertain macroeconomic environment. Companies ranging from ⁠Big Tech to up-and-coming advertising platforms have been fighting each other for prized ad dollars, creating an increasingly competitive landscape, ​challenging providers ​such as AppLovin.

headline: Earnings in Focus Wednesday: Cisco, McDonald’s, Shopify, Lyft
summary: ↘️ Cisco Systems (CSCO): The networking company logged higher revenue from increasing demand from artificial intelligence hyperscalers. Shares slipped about 3% afterhours however as some investors took profits after a strong run for the stock so far in 2026.
